required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of a 12 Week Treatment of Acute Diverticulitis With Asacol速 2.4 g/Day (400 mg Mesalamine Tablet), Followed by a 9 Month Treatment-free Observation Period

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether Asacol速 2.4 g/day (400 mg Mesalamine) is safe and effective in the treatment of diverticulitis.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Asacol速 2.4 g/day in generally healthy, adult patients who have had an attack of acute diverticulitis. The study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of a 12 week treatment with Asacol速 followed a 9 month non-treatment observation period in approximately 180 patients with acute diverticulitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Global Symptom Score (GSS) at Week 12, Primary Efficacy Population
primary_outcome.description: GSS - Abdominal Pain & Symptom Rating, scale 0-none (better) to 6-severe (worse) for each of the following categories: abdominal pain, abdominal tenderness, nausea/vomiting, bloating, constipation, diarrhea, mucus in stool, feeling urge to evacuate but no bowel movement, painful straining with bowel movement, pain/difficulty urinating. Total minimum score 0 (better), total maximum score 60 (worse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Responders at Week 12 - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: Responder - patient whose GSS scores for all symptoms were either 0 or 1 GSS - Abdominal Pain & Symptom Rating, scale 0-none (better) to 6-severe (worse) for each of the following categories: abdominal pain, abdominal tenderness, nausea/vomiting, bloating, constipation, diarrhea, mucus in stool, feeling urge to evacuate but no bowel movement, painful straining with bowel movement, pain/difficulty urinating. Total minimum score 0 (better), total maximum score 60 (worse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Responders at Week 52 - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: Responder - patient whose GSS scores for all symptoms were either 0 or 1 GSS - Abdominal Pain & Symptom Rating, scale 0-none (better) to 6-severe (worse) for each of the following categories: abdominal pain, abdominal tenderness, nausea/vomiting, bloating, constipation, diarrhea, mucus in stool, feeling urge to evacuate but no bowel movement, painful straining with bowel movement, pain/difficulty urinating. Total minimum score 0 (better), total maximum score 60 (worse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in GSS From Baseline to Week 12 - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: GSS - Abdominal Pain & Symptom Rating, scale 0-none (better) to 6-severe (worse) for each of the following categories: abdominal pain, abdominal tenderness, nausea/vomiting, bloating, constipation, diarrhea, mucus in stool, feeling urge to evacuate but no bowel movement, painful straining with bowel movement, pain/difficulty urinating. Total minimum score 0 (better), total maximum score 60 (worse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in GSS From Baseline to Week 52 - ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: GSS - Abdominal Pain & Symptom Rating, scale 0-none (better) to 6-severe (worse) for each of the following categories: abdominal pain, abdominal tenderness, nausea/vomiting, bloating, constipation, diarrhea, mucus in stool, feeling urge to evacuate but no bowel movement, painful straining with bowel movement, pain/difficulty urinating. Total minimum score 0 (better), total maximum score 60 (worse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Withdrawal Due to Surgery for Diverticulitis, Percentage, ITT Population, Week 12
Recurrent Diverticulitis, Percentage, ITT Population, Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: At least one report of recurrent diverticulitis since the last visit (prior to the Week 12 visit).

secondary_outcome.measure: Recurrent Diverticulitis, Percentage, ITT Population, Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: At least one report of recurrent diverticulitis since the last visit (prior to the Week 52 visit).

arm_group.description: Days 1 thru Days 10 to 14 (Visit 2): daily antibiotic therapy, dietary advice, and 6 placebo tablets (matching mesalamine) once a day. Visit 2 thru Week 12 : 1 placebo capsule (matching probiotic) and 6 placebo tablets (matching mesalamine) daily.

Days 1 thru 10-14 (Visit 2): daily antibiotic therapy, dietary advice and 6 - 400 mg mesalamine tablets once a day. Visit 2 thru Week 12: 1 placebo capsule (matching probiotic) and 6 - 400 mg mesalamine tablets daily.

Days 1 thru 10-14 (Visit 2): daily antibiotic therapy, dietary advice and 6 - 400 mg mesalamine tablets once daily. Visit 2 thru Week 12: 1- Bifidobacterium infantis 35624 capsule and 6 - 400 mg mesalamine tablets daily

intervention.description: Once capsule daily Bifidobacterium infantis 35624 added at Visit 2 (Day 10 + 4 days)
6 placebo tablets for first 10 (+4) days followed by once daily placebo tablets.
Physician recommended antibiotic for Diverticulitis taken for 10-14 days. Antibiotic not specified for study.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Randomization 1:1:1 ratio with subsequent stratification based on number of prior episodes (1 attack vs. more than 1 attack).

group.title: Mesalamine & Probiotic
group.description: 400 mg mesalamine (6 tablets daily) plus Align (1 capsule daily)

group.description: 400 mg mesalamine (6 tablets daily) plus Align (1 capsule daily)

outcome.title: Global Symptom Score (GSS) at Week 12, Primary Efficacy Population
outcome.description: GSS - Abdominal Pain & Symptom Rating, scale 0-none (better) to 6-severe (worse) for each of the following categories: abdominal pain, abdominal tenderness, nausea/vomiting, bloating, constipation, diarrhea, mucus in stool, feeling urge to evacuate but no bowel movement, painful straining with bowel movement, pain/difficulty urinating. Total minimum score 0 (better), total maximum score 60 (worse).
outcome.population: Primary Efficacy Population - Subset of ITT population including only patients with GSS value at Week 12 and baseline GSS of at least 12.

group.title: Mesalamine & Probiotic
group.description: 400 mg mesalamine (6 tablets daily) plus Align (1 capsule daily)

measure.title: Global Symptom Score (GSS) at Week 12, Primary Efficacy Population
measure.description: GSS - Abdominal Pain & Symptom Rating, scale 0-none (better) to 6-severe (worse) for each of the following categories: abdominal pain, abdominal tenderness, nausea/vomiting, bloating, constipation, diarrhea, mucus in stool, feeling urge to evacuate but no bowel movement, painful straining with bowel movement, pain/difficulty urinating. Total minimum score 0 (better), total maximum score 60 (worse).
measure.population: Primary Efficacy Population - Subset of ITT population including only patients with GSS value at Week 12 and baseline GSS of at least 12.

analysis.groups_desc: It was assumed that the placebo treatment group and mesalamine treatment group would have an average composite score of 8.4 and 5.88 at Week 12, respectively. The common standard deviation was set to 4.5 based on the 2 standard deviation rule. Based on these assumptions, 60 patients per treatment group required to detect 30% treatment difference at 1-sided, 0.1 level of significance, with 80% power.
analysis.method_desc: Fixed effects for treatment, number of diverticulitis attacks and baseline value as covariate.

reported_events.desc: Intent to Treat Population. Adverse Events were differentiated by occurring either in the treatment period (initial 12 weeks therapy) or the non-treatment period (9 month follow up period) using the corresponding numbers from participant flow for each of the trial periods specified.

group.title: Mesalamine & Probiotic
group.description: 400 mg mesalamine (6 tablets daily) plus Align (1 capsule daily)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
